page.title: 13NATURE TRAIL, SOUTHWELL (2)
page.content: To the east, was Kirkilington Station, similar to Farnsfield, but wothout a warehouse. There is now a car park and picnic area in the yard. Over a cutting are two bridges, one of which used to carry Nottingham Corporation's water supply. This now runs underground. About a mile further east, is Maythorne crossing. A crossing next to the bridge had to be made because the bridge was too low for high farm loads. The old Southwell level crossing marks the end of the trail. There is the old Greet Lily Mill - flour used to be produced here by grinding. It was owned by the Booth and then the Cauldwell families. The Newcastle Arms public house here was set up for passengers on the railway.
